description:
About us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. We embrace flexibility, so our people can be their best inside and outside of work. We champion inclusion and continuous learning, ensuring all voices are heard and valued. And we thrive on collaboration, turning challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation.  As a leader in national security, our innovative and diverse programs create a more secure future for Australia across space, air, land, sea, and cyber domains. Every day is a chance to solve the world’s most complex challenges and make a profound impact. Experience it here.

This position is within Lockheed Martin Australia’s Engineering Services Contract (ESC) team, supporting the Jindalee Over the Horizon RADAR Network (JORN).  As part of (ESC) Lockheed Martin provide rapid agile capability development services to the CoA, supporting the evaluation of JORN system enhancements prior to their formal incorporation into the baseline.

As well as this rapid capability development, we perform an independent V&V test program.  The role of the ESC Software Engineer within the team will encompass the full lifecycle of the DevSecOps and ICT tasks to be performed, while adapting the level of technical assurance to balance risk against the customer timelines.

A key aspect of the role is the ability to adapt solutions to the needs of end users and to maintain an awareness of alternate technologies that may be applicable to the domain.




Responsibilities

Working under guidance as part of a highly skilled engineering team, you will:

·         Perform DevSecOps and ICT tasks within a Linux-based environment

·         Configure and maintain infrastructure to support software development teams

·         Identify, deploy, and maintain development tools and pipelines

·         Undertake system administration activities

·         Support cyber compliance tasks

·         Assist with resolving issues identified during software development, integration, and testing

You will also be responsible for resolution of relevant problems identified during the conduct of software development, integration and test.

About you:

To be successful in this role, you will bring:

Experience writing Ansible roles

Strong Linux Administration capability

Tooling administration experience

Kubernetes knowledge

Experience configuring and running Continuous Integration workers

Familiarity with logging, metrics collection, and visualisation tools

Experience with RHEL

Strong skills in configuring operating systems (servers, workstations, diskless systems)

Kickstart configuration experience

RPM packaging experience

Experience with Satellite configuration and management

Understanding of software engineering processes, procedures, and product lifecycles

Ability to apply experiential judgement and lateral thinking to complex problems

 

Desirable

Knowledge of SELinux and Auditd

Experience configuring syslog, rsyslog, and logrotate

Understanding and tuning of NFS

Repository management experience

Experience implementing ISM compliance

Software development in a Linux environment

 

How we reward and support you:

When you join Lockheed Martin, you work on projects you won’t experience anywhere else.

We offer you a range of benefits built to suit you, no matter what stage of life you are in. 

·         Flexible work & Hybrid work options

·         Access to our online discounts program offering immediate discounts or cashback

·         A variety of leave options including Purchase Leave to support you and your family  

·         Additional benefits such as Novated Leasing and Fitness Programs

·         Learning & Development platforms to encourage ongoing self-development

Special Requirements:

Applicants must be eligible to obtain and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance and employment may be contingent on the provision of further personal information including citizenship to ensure compliance with international export control legislation and regulations.

A Veteran-friendly Workplace:

Veterans are encouraged to apply. We highly value the unique skills and experiences that veterans and transitioning service members can contribute to our team. We are proud to be recognised as a Veteran Friendly Employer by the Australian Government.
